meanings.definition: Difficult to control or deal with
meanings.sent1: The intractable problem seemed impossible to solve.
meanings.sent2: The teacher found the intractable student challenging to manage.
meanings.sent3: The intractable computer virus refused to be removed, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: Her intractable fear of heights paralyzed her from climbing the ladder.
meanings.sent5: The intractable knot in the rope resisted all attempts to untangle it.

meanings.sent1: The intractable child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The old car was intractable and always broke down.
meanings.sent3: The intractable cat refused to come inside despite the rain.
meanings.sent4: His intractable determination to finish the race kept him going.
meanings.sent5: The intractable stain on the carpet wouldn't budge no matter what she tried.

meanings.sent1: Her intractable beliefs remained steadfast despite opposition.
meanings.sent2: The intractable rock formation stood unchanged for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The intractable clock refused to be set correctly, always running fast.
meanings.sent4: His intractable loyalty to his friends never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The intractable weather pattern persisted, bringing rain every day.
